ratings.question_text: How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: Matt is an excellent teacher, perhaps the best I've taken a class with at FES. The lessons were very high quality, and it is amazing how much Matt makes himself available to help students.

Matt Eckelman is a great professor and I found this course very useful / interesting. The readings were very helpful as were the in class LCA tutorials with SimaPro. I also found the projects to be very exciting and applicable to current environmental issues. Great work!
This is a great skills-based class. It is useful both in terms of the LCA modeling skill taught, as well as the real-world consulting experience working with clients on a project.

We had few logistical glitches. First, the license of the software expired before the semester ended. This delayed in submission of the project report. Second, the client must be provide a clarity of what they want and also provide information beforehand.

The instructionin this course is terrific. The subject is large enough (and the need for practical work in it is acute enough) that the course ends up being unsatisfying, but I don't know if this is avoidable, and it's a great start. Perhaps linking the homeworks together would help create a sense of continuity and development?
LCA Practicum is a wonderfully hands-on experience, giving us real skills that we can take into the future, and is mostly determined by the dynamics of the student team.
I think pretty much everything. Sorry, I know that's not very constructive.
Final project, with close connection with the client

Professor Matt Eckelman--is is knowledgeable, genuinely interested in student learning, and extremely willing to listen and assist students in any way he can. He keeps up with both the literature and real world practice, a unique trait for FES instructors!
The class project. It's very rewarding.
The learning the LCA tool and its wide application.

Professor Eckelman is an excellent teacher. His engagement in the topic is infectious and he really cares about helping the students deepen their understanding of the topic. The lectures were well thought out, the class discussions were interesting, and the client project was a great experience. I came away from that class feeling like I had gained a well-rounded understanding of the LCA literature as well as a practicable skill that I can take with me into a career. Overall, this class was a 10 out of 10.
Great introduction to LCA taught by someone who knows it very well.
Its project-based and tutorial nature that gave us real skills.

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: Not sure I can think of anything. It's very well organized and implemented.
Maybe needs a TA?Expands the class capacity--it's popular
The assignments could be refined so that students better understand the task and what they're supposed to get out of it.
The classroom. I think 380 Edwards is not appropiate for this type of course.
The client we were working with delayed the project details and made it tough for us to finish the project within the deadline. More clarity and information would be very helpful.
The homeworks were pretty time consuming. Also, the "assigned readings" were really not necessary given that most of the learning came from actually doing the homework assignments.

The course format could be improved. The discussion part of the class was a bit forced and often students didn't want to participate - better not to push it. I think its ok to have the classes end a bit early and let there be some breathing room in a 3 hours long class.
Any deficiencies in my experience were honestly the result of my own distraction and anxieties about the future.

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: Great. See Q11.
AWESOME. As mentioned above, Matt was the best part of the class. He's a great professor.
Matthew is a great professor, always willing to help. He replies all emails, and goes beyond the expected.
The instructor was always available for input and information.
Professor Eckelman was consistently available and helpful. I wish there were more professors like him at FES.
Matt is great and really helpful when questions arose.
Matt was always around to help, and did very well.

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: The class is a good fit for anyone who wants to use LCA or just understand it for any host of reasons: Consulting, design, policy, research, etc.

I am an MEM focused on industrial environmental management. LCA is the hot tool right now in any applied sustainability approach or program. Very valuable skill to have if you want to work internally or as a consultant.
If you're into sustainability / industrial ecology, this is a MUST.

As an environmental manager, LCA will benefit me in terms environmental analysis of a product not only in terms of consumption impact but also by analysis of the product by detailed breakdown of its production stages.
This class has given me a real skill that I think will help me add value to the workforce.
I am interested in industrial ecology.
I wanted to gain tangible skills that I could take with me professionally, after a liberal arts and academic research background. It did.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: I wanted to learn LCA and the class came highly recommended.
Required skill for my interest area.
I always wanted to learn this tool.
The obvious reason being learning the LCA tool and its broad application and flexibility in environmental analysis.
To become savvy in LCA tools
See Question 15, and this was my Masters Capstone.

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
comments: Yes
Yes.
Sure
Yes. Very much.
Yes.
Yes - a great intro to LCA and hybrid tools that are used in industry.
Yes, completely, although I still would like to use the software more.

narratives.question_text: Did you get out of it what you expected?
comments: Yes.
Had I spent more time on the Class project, I would've learnt even more.
Yes.
Yes.
Yes
Yes, and more. I also learned important skills of pacing a project and working with a group.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Unfortunately, the group work turned out to be my least favorite part about the class. Sometimes not everyone in a group puts in the same amount of work. Because this was the case, I ended up feeling like I could have done a much better job on the project if I was not in a group.
The real world consulting experience was great.
You learn to think ahead of time, avoid innecesary work, and respect others' opinions.
disproportionate division of work

The Simapro is not a user friendly tool. Though we were both working on the data, we could only enter the data into one computer and the data could not be imported. This made it tough and very time consuming.The software itself made it tough as we had to work together each time& could not work independently.

Partners should be allowed to rate each other at the end of the process for grade input (as is standard practice at the School of Management). Work in my group was not fairly balanced between everyone. The point of a grading system is not to punish but to create incentives for equal participation; without that, problems can arise. This is especially important for an explicitly pre-professional class.

I loved every aspect of the group work. Sometimes group work at FES can be frustrating, but for this particular group, it was fantastic. I learned so much more by working with the group rather than on my own.
I also learned important skills of pacing a project and working with a group.

narratives.question_text: For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Take the class.Get started on your final project immediately. Gathering the data you need for your LCA is going to be harder than you think and you will not find it all in Simapro.
As I read in previous course evaluations: Start working on your class project ASAP!
Its an excellent application to assess environmental impact and encourage any prospective environmental manager or consultant to take it.
Take it if you are interested in business strategy, industrial ecology, energy, etc.
Start the project as early as possible, because researching data sources takes a long time!
